channel.title: Source Help!
channel.description: ok im using a pi source and what do i change source ip to when im hosting it: [IMG]http://i53.tinypic.com/2m5m53r.jpg[/img] i know i change the client to 127.0.0.1 but what about source?

item.title: Source Help!
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

Vhenoms right that doesn’t matter it just says that just backspace the 0.0.0.0 and leave the port so that you know what port it’s on. If you did the client right you need to fix your portforwarding if other people can’t log on. Major tip: If you don’t have cable or dsl internet you can’t portforward. And if you have suddenlink you cant portforward. <-- I went through hell figuring that out DON’T FORGET IT! It should be on every single portforwarding tutorial…

Read full topic

item.title: Source Help!
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

Supposed to be like that…but if it bothers you. Go to server.java in your source, and CTRL+F “0.0.” and it should be the first one that comes up, rename it, compile, update.

Read full topic
